Yes git ignore changes are intentional as doing development via eclipse it adds those directories so for a clean status check it is necessary to ignore those directories and files. If all is OK please merge the same.

Hey guys, I accidentally found this PR and added my 2 cents. I have not seen output from findbugs, so maybe they are inaccurate.

@junrao @ijuma I took a shot to fix this. Not sure if there is a better way to do this. 

Another option is to to just change the default message.timestamp.difference.max.ms back to Long.MaxValue, because that was only a optimization, but it seems already introduced a few issues.

Thanks @guozhangwang for feedback, I am quite new in this community, therefore at the very beginning I asked for review and when I got positive feedback I thought everything was fine so I continued to work on it. Now I am puzzled and want to ask if I understood it correctly. I shall open new PR where will be only one change? To make it explicit, I will open one PR when I will rewrite vars to val in one file, another PR for the TODO I propose, another PR for changing case class var to val, etc.?
